div.p: 1. Cut each chicken breast into 3 pieces. Place chicken pieces between 2 sheets of heavy-duty plastic wrap, and flatten to ¾-inch thickness using a rolling pin or meat mallet.

2. In a small bowl, whisk together 1 cup buffalo sauce, dressing mix, and celery seeds. Place chicken into a large heavy-duty resealable bag. Add buffalo sauce mixture; seal and turn to coat. Chill for 2 to 4 hours.
3. Spray grill with nonstick nonflammable cooking spray and preheat to medium-high heat (350° to 400°). Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade.
4. Grill chicken for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until a meat thermometer inserted into thickest portion registers 165°. Toss chicken with remaining 1 cup buffalo sauce.
5. Place 1 piece of chicken on bottom half of each bun. Spread about 2 tablespoons Blue Cheese Dip on cut sides of top half of buns and place, sauce side down, on chicken. Serve immediately.
This dip is as great with corn or tortilla chips as it is on the sliders.

1. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese at medium speed with a mixer until smooth. Add ½ cup sour cream, beating until smooth. Add remaining sour cream, beating until smooth. Stir in blue cheese, green onions, parsley, and pepper. Cover and chill until ready to serve.
“Here’s how we roll with these sandwiches: I marinate the chicken at home and take it to the picnic, then Michael grills it on site.”
Anything you would keep in the refrigerator at home should be stored in an ice-packed cooler until you’re ready to cook or eat.
